cards.desc:
Attachment is wrong!  Ignore the hair type selector at the head.



the landing page will have a variety of photos and text describing the product.  There will be a 'Shop' button that begins the wig selection process.

The shop button will be sticky so that you can always start shopping
cards.name: As a customer I want to view a landing page describing the product

cards.desc: Enter address, and payment details
cards.name: As a customer I want to check out my current wig.

cards.desc: The customer is presented with the featured image for each collection.  They can click on a collection to continue the purchase flow using the products in that collection.
cards.name: As a customer I want to choose the collection for my hairpiece

cards.desc:
The hairpiece products here are determined by what collection has been selected in the previous step.

For portrait in tablet and desktop the grid should stack and maintain aspect ratio.

For large sizes, it will expand to full width grid.
cards.name: As a customer I want to choose the type of hairpiece

cards.desc: The wig type product category will show two wig type products side by side.  Only the first two wig types are shown.
cards.name: As a customer I want to choose the type of wig if I chose a wig

cards.desc:
Here the fine / coarse are 'texture' variants of the hair type.

Only the first two texture variants are shown; with buttons side-by-side.

When you click the straight wavy or curly it shows the fine or coarse buttons which you can then click to make the selection.
cards.name: As a customer I want to choose the type of hair; straight wavy or curly
As a customer I want to choose the texture of the hair; coarse or fine

cards.desc: The current selection (or hover) will be displayed on the left hand side.
cards.name: As a customer I want to choose the length of hair

cards.desc: There are several colour collections; each of which has a subset of colours.

cards.name: As a customer I want to select the hair style

cards.desc: The size is either Closure or Frontal and contained within the base type screen.
cards.name: As a customer I want to choose the base size of the hairpiece

cards.desc:
The colour is either transparent, or light medium or dark brown.

Selection is made in the base selection screen.
cards.name: As a customer I want to choose the base colour of the hairpiece

cards.desc: The user will be able to edit the different measurement fields.  These measurements will be added as a note in the order email.
cards.name: As a customer I want to input my head measurements

cards.desc:
Editorial image (always the same)

If the user clicks edit beside an item, they are taken to that step in the order and can continue in the normal flow.  The new product they choose with that category will replace the current product of that category.
cards.name: As a customer I want to verify my order before I purchase

cards.desc: Re-use Spree checkout code.
cards.name: As a customer I want to purchase a wig.

cards.desc:
The order verification page will include a quantity selection to pick the number of hair pieces.

cards.name: As a customer I want to change the quantity of the configured product I want to buy.

cards.desc:
Reuse the order summary, include the logo at the bottom.

Notes:  cannot use custom fonts in emails.  Email will not be responsive.
cards.name: As a customer I want to receive an email of my order after confirmation.

cards.desc:
The URL will encode a complete wig.  When the user visits the site, they will be brought to the verify order page.

Spree Backend:

Create custom HTTP parameter that populates the shopping cart using a past order id.

Frontend: The user should be taken to the order confirmation page where they can edit their order.

cards.desc:
This could be the shopping cart button in the top right.

1. If the user has partially completed a wig and they press the cart button they will be brought to the next step in completion.
2. If the user has completed their wig they will be brought to the order verification page.
3. If the user hasn't selected any products they are brought to the collections page.
